actions.committee: Senate Committee on Rules and Administration
actions.text: Referred to Senate Committee on Rules and Administration.
Reported to Senate from the Committee on Rules and Administration with amendments, S. Rept. 94-521.
Measure called up by unanimous consent in Senate.

official_title: A resolution to amend rule XXII of the Standing Rules of the U.S. Senate to provide for the consideration of amendments submitted to the Presiding Officer prior to a cloture vote.

summary.text: (Measure passed Senate, amended) Provides under the Standing Rules of the Senate that, except by unanimous consent, no amendment shall be proposed after the vote to bring the debate to a close, unless the same has been submitted in writing to the Journal Clerk prior to the end of the vote.

titles.title: A resolution to amend rule XXII of the Standing Rules of the U.S. Senate to provide for the consideration of amendments submitted to the Presiding Officer prior to a cloture vote.
